alert.note: Alert for South and East Jackson, Larimer, North and Northeast Grand, Northwest Boulder Counties Above 9000 Feet; South and Southeast Grand, West Central and Southwest Boulder, Gilpin, Clear Creek, Summit, North and West Park Counties Above 9000 Feet (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued December 25 at 1:48PM MST until December 27 at 5:00AM MST by NWS Boulder
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 5 AM SUNDAY TO 5 AM MST MONDAY... * WHAT...Snow expected. Additional snow accumulations of 4 to 8 inches. Wind gusts of 30 to 50 mph will be common, with gusts as high as 70 mph above timberline in the Front Range. * WHERE...Rocky Mountain National Park and the Medicine Bow Range, and The Mountains of Summit County, the Mosquito Range, and the Indian Peaks. * WHEN...Snow and wind will increase Sunday morning and snow may be heavy at times during the day. The snow will diminish overnight Sunday night, but it will remain windy with extensive blowing and drifting snow over higher areas. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult, with intermittent road closures possible.
info.instruction: Consider altering your travel plans to avoid travel during the day Sunday. Heavy snowfall is expected to make travel difficult. If you do travel, carry extra food, water and fuel along with warm clothing. Be prepared for slow travel and possible road closures. The latest road conditions for Colorado can be obtained by calling 5 1 1 or by going to www.cotrip.org
